cards.flavor: "When one has witnessed the unspeakable, 'tis sometimes better to forget." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: Amnesia
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards.

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

cards.name: Apprentice Wizard
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Ashes to Ashes
cards.text: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

cards.flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.
cards.name: Banshee
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to target creature or player, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.

cards.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.
cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.
cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.
cards.name: Blood of the Martyr
cards.text: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.

cards.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.
cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.flavor: After the Battle of Pitdown, Lady Ursnell fashioned the first such instrument out of Lord Ursnell's left leg.
cards.name: Bone Flute
cards.text: {2}, {T}: All creatures get -1/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."
cards.name: Brainwash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.flavor: Fire is never a gentle master.
cards.name: Brothers of Fire
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Brothers of Fire deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: Carnivorous Plant
cards.text: Defender

cards.name: Cave People
cards.text:
Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn.
{1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: City of Shadows
cards.text:
{T}, Exile a creature you control: Put a storage counter on City of Shadows.
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool for each storage counter on City of Shadows.

cards.name: Cleansing
cards.text: For each land, destroy that land unless any player pays 1 life.

cards.flavor: "Three such creatures stood burning at the crest of the hill. Only seconds later, the Fireball struck our front line." —Lydia, Countess Brellis
cards.name: Coal Golem
cards.text: {3}, Sacrifice Coal Golem: Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.
cards.name: Curse Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Curse Artifact deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she sacrifices that artifact.

cards.name: Dance of Many
cards.text:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, create a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature.
When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.
When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

cards.flavor: Even the Goblins shun this haunted place, where the tree limbs twist in agony and the ground seems to scuttle under your feet.
cards.name: Dark Heart of the Wood
cards.text: Sacrifice a Forest: You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: "I was struck senseless for a moment, but revived when the strange curiosity I carried fell to the ground, screaming like a dying animal." —Barl, Lord Ith
cards.name: Dark Sphere
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Dark Sphere: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent half that damage, rounded down.

cards.name: Deep Water
cards.text: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.

cards.flavor: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning." —Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor
cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.

cards.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."
cards.name: Drowned
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.

cards.flavor: Tervish never noticed that the amulet had vanished. It had disappeared not only from his possession, but from his memory as well.
cards.name: Dust to Dust
cards.text: Exile two target artifacts.

cards.flavor: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.
cards.name: Eater of the Dead
cards.text: {0}: If Eater of the Dead is tapped, exile target creature card from a graveyard and untap Eater of the Dead.

cards.name: Electric Eel
cards.text:
When Electric Eel enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to you.
{R}{R}: Electric Eel gets +2/+0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor: "They are aberrations who have turned on everything we hold sacred. Let them be cast out." —Ailheen, Speaker of the Council
cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Erosion
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

cards.name: Eternal Flame
cards.text: Eternal Flame deals X damage to target opponent, where X is the number of Mountains you control. It deals half X damage, rounded up, to you.

cards.flavor: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.
cards.name: Exorcist
cards.text: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.

cards.name: Fasting
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a hunger counter on Fasting. Then destroy Fasting if it has five or more hunger counters on it.
If you would begin your draw step, you may skip that step instead. If you do, you gain 2 life.
When you draw a card, destroy Fasting.

cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, called the Pretender
cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.flavor: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.
cards.name: Festival
cards.text:
Cast Festival only during an opponent's upkeep.
Creatures can't attack this turn.

cards.name: Fire and Brimstone
cards.text: Fire and Brimstone deals 4 damage to target player who declared an attacking creature this turn and 4 damage to you.

cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?" —Plato
cards.name: Fissure
cards.text: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.

cards.flavor:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War
cards.name: Flood
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

cards.flavor: The Fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.
cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Frankenstein's Monster
cards.text: As Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield, exile X creature cards from your graveyard. If you can't, put Frankenstein's Monster into its owner's graveyard instead of onto the battlefield. For each creature card exiled this way, Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield with a +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2 counter on it.

cards.name: Gaea's Touch
cards.text:
{0}: You may put a basic Forest card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.
Sacrifice Gaea's Touch: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below." —Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad
cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.text:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.

cards.name: Giant Shark
cards.text:
Giant Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
Whenever Giant Shark blocks or becomes blocked by a creature that has been dealt damage this turn, Giant Shark gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Giant Shark.

cards.flavor: The stench of countless generations of unspeakable activities was enough to loosen both our footing and our stomachs.
cards.name: Goblin Caves
cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.

cards.flavor: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.flavor: They attacked in an orgy of rage and madness, but only one seemed as focused on killing us as on the sheer joy of battle.
cards.name: Goblin Hero
Goblin Rock Sled
cards.text:
Trample
Goblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn.
Goblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.

cards.flavor: "I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know." —Norin the Wary
cards.name: Goblin Shrine
cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.

cards.name: Goblin Wizard
cards.text:
{T}: You may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
{R}: Target Goblin gains protection from white until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblins of the Flarg
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
When you control a Dwarf, sacrifice Goblins of the Flarg.

cards.flavor: "If you don't have your health, you don't have anything." —Proverb
cards.name: Grave Robbers
cards.text: {B}, {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard. You gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: "Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: Hidden Path
cards.text: Green creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired." —The Book of Tal
cards.name: Holy Light
cards.text: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames." —Mairsil, called the Pretender
cards.name: Inferno
cards.text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.flavor: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.
cards.name: Inquisition
cards.text: Target player reveals his or her hand. Inquisition deals damage to that player equal to the number of white cards in his or her hand.

cards.flavor: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks." —Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars
cards.name: Knights of Thorn
cards.text: Protection from red; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.flavor: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: Land Leeches
cards.text: First strike

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

cards.flavor: Though it affords excellent protection, few don this armor. The process is uncomfortable and not easily reversed.
cards.name: Living Armor
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Living Armor: Put X +0/+1 counters on target creature, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Lurker
cards.text: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.

cards.name: Mana Clash
cards.text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

cards.name: Mana Vortex
cards.text:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.
When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

cards.flavor: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late." —Keevy Bogsbury
cards.name: Marsh Gas
cards.text: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Even the other Goblin races shun the Marsh Goblins, thanks to certain unwholesome customs they practice.
cards.name: Marsh Goblins
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Marsh Viper
cards.text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

cards.flavor: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: Martyr's Cry
cards.text: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.

cards.name: Maze of Ith
cards.text: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

cards.name: Merfolk Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target creature with islandwalk.

cards.name: Mind Bomb
cards.text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards he or she discarded this way.

cards.flavor: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul." —Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints
cards.name: Miracle Worker
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.

cards.flavor: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan." —Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars
cards.name: Morale
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.
cards.name: Murk Dwellers
cards.text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

cards.name: Nameless Race
cards.text:
Trample
As Nameless Race enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. The amount you pay can't be more than the total number of white nontoken permanents your opponents control plus the total number of white cards in their graveyards.
Nameless Race's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Necropolis
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put X +0/+1 counters on Necropolis, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.
cards.name: Niall Silvain
cards.text: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

cards.flavor: "Your army must fear you more than the enemy. Only then will you triumph." —Malga Phlegmtooth
cards.name: Orc General
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice another Orc or Goblin: Other Orc creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies." —Vervamon the Elder
cards.name: People of the Woods
cards.text: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.

cards.flavor: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Preacher
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Preacher during your untap step.
{T}: For as long as Preacher remains tapped, gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice he or she controls.

cards.name: Psychic Allergy
cards.text:
As Psychic Allergy enters the battlefield, choose a color.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color he or she controls.
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Psychic Allergy unless you sacrifice two Islands.

cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"
cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Reflecting Mirror
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the converted mana cost of that spell.

cards.name: Riptide
cards.text: Tap all blue creatures.

cards.name: Runesword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: "Purity of magic can only come from purity of the land. How can a meal nourish if the ingredients are spoiled?" —Sidaine of Savaen
cards.name: Savaen Elves
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.

cards.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.
cards.name: Scarecrow
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Scarwood Bandits
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Larger and more cunning than most Goblins, Scarwood Goblins are thankfully found only in isolated pockets.
cards.name: Scarwood Goblins
Scarwood Hag
cards.text:
{G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{T}: Target creature loses forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.
cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Season of the Witch
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Season of the Witch unless you pay 2 life.
At the beginning of the end step, destroy all untapped creatures that didn't attack this turn, except for creatures that couldn't attack.

cards.flavor: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.
cards.name: Sisters of the Flame
cards.text: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Though lifeless, the Skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.
cards.name: Skull of Orm
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sorrow's Path
cards.text:
{T}: Choose two target blocking creatures an opponent controls. If each of those creatures could block all creatures that the other is blocking, remove both of them from combat. Each one then blocks all creatures the other was blocking.
Whenever Sorrow's Path becomes tapped, it deals 2 damage to you and each creature you control.

cards.name: Spitting Slug
cards.text: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse. Of his stature he was of even lengthe. And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe." —Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales
cards.name: Squire
Standing Stones
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The Pretender Mairsil ordered a great Calendar drawn up to show when the paths to the Dark Lands were strongest.
cards.name: Stone Calendar
cards.text: Spells you cast cost up to {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Sunken City
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sunken City unless you pay {U}{U}.
Blue creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Tangle Kelp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Tangle Kelp enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step if it attacked during its controller's last turn.

cards.flavor: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.
cards.name: The Fallen
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent it has dealt damage to this game.

cards.name: Tivadar's Crusade
cards.text: Destroy all Goblins.

cards.flavor: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.
cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Tower of Coireall
cards.text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked by Walls this turn.

cards.name: Tracker
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tracker.

cards.flavor: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.
cards.name: Uncle Istvan
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.

cards.flavor: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, a wee scratch, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Venom
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Wand of Ith
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player reveals a card at random from his or her hand. If it's a land card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 1 life. If it isn't a land card, the player discards it unless he or she pays life equal to its converted mana cost. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: War Barge
cards.text: {3}: Target creature gains islandwalk until end of turn. When War Barge leaves the battlefield this turn, destroy that creature. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated. (A creature with islandwalk can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Water Wurm
cards.text: Water Wurm gets +0/+1 as long as an opponent controls an Island.

cards.flavor: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.
cards.name: Whippoorwill
cards.text: {G}{G}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn. Damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn can't be prevented or dealt instead to another creature or player. When the creature dies this turn, exile the creature.

cards.name: Witch Hunter
cards.text:
{T}: Witch Hunter deals 1 damage to target player.
{1}{W}{W}, {T}: Return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "That was the worst experience of my days, standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier
cards.name: Word of Binding
cards.text: Tap X target creatures.

cards.flavor: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.
cards.name: Worms of the Earth
cards.text:
Players can't play lands.
Lands can't enter the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to him or her. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.

cards.name: Wormwood Treefolk
cards.text:
{G}{G}: Wormwood Treefolk gains forestwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{B}{B}: Wormwood Treefolk gains swampwalk until end of turn and deals 2 damage to you. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
